title: Hagar and Ishmael
summary: Genesis 16 recounts how Sarai, unable to have children, gives her servant Hagar to Abram. Hagar conceives and is mistreated, so she flees. God meets her in the wilderness and promises that her son Ishmael will become a great nation.

faq.question: Why did Sarai give Hagar to Abram?
faq.answer: Sarai was barren and hoped to build a family through her servant Hagar.

faq.question: What was Godâ€™s promise to Hagar?
faq.answer: That her son Ishmael would have many descendants and become a great nation.
